title: Cannot get file extension from SWT FileDialog
description: When using the SWT FileDialog, it is not possible to determine the file extension. This makes the dialog almost unusable as it is impossible to append the correct file extension to the file name.
OB: When selecting a file using the SWT FileDialog, the file extension cannot be retrieved.
EB: The export wizard should use the file name 'test.zip' when this issue occurs.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Select a java file. 
2) Go to File -> Export... 
3) Select JAR file and click Next. 
4) Click Browse... to select a Save As file dialog. 
5) Enter 'test' for the file name. 
6) Select '.zip' for the 'Save as type' field. 
7) Click Save. 
Result: The JAR export wizard uses 'test' for the JAR file field. 
Expected result: The JAR export wizard should use 'test.zip' for the JAR file field.
